Schematic drawing of the large intestine of the domestic mammals: camivores (Car), the pig (su), ruminants (Ru), and the horse (eq). Cranial is to the upper right. 1, lleum; 2, cecum; 3, ascending colon; 4, transverse colon; 5, descending colon; 6, rectum and anus; 7, aorta; 8, celiac artery, 9, 9', cranial and caudal mesenteric arteries; 10, 10', dorsal diaphragmatic and pelvic flexures of ascending colon; 11, 11°, proximal and distal loops of ascending colon Copyright © 2010 by Seunders, an impeint of Elsevier Inc.
